channel.title: Chipped xbox 360
channel.description: Well I'm looking at buying one, basically wanna know what sort of price I can expect to pay and where the best place to buy one is. Any suggestions I'd help with this?

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:47, topic:282126”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=372777.msg2820223#msg2820223 date=1244559396]
What a cunt. I’ve been playing burned xbox 360 games for 3+ months now. I haven’t gotten banned yet either, iXtreme is pretty safe firmware.
[/quote]

Cool, do they have a website? I am assuming they support online games aswell? are these on the public Xbox servers? or private ones?[/quote]

Public XBox servers Ollie my petal, you can play just as if it was a legit game, on a legit console with your friends online.

http://www.ixtreme.net/ is the public website for ixtreme, it just provides tutorials / sources etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @united0wnage united0wnage
item.description:
@united0wnage wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:282126”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=372777.msg2814770#msg2814770 date=1244222095]

After that depending on who you get your games from they’re about $10 each.

What?

Just what I was thinking. Don’t you download and burn them for free?

Don’t waste your money on modding an xbox, because it will just burn out in a few months anyway. Go Wii.

ive got a wii and a PS3
[/quote]

Then mod the Wii and have fun. I’d get an xbox and mod it too if there wasn’t a 100% chance I would have to buy another one inside of a year, it’s a huge waste of money.[/quote]

That’s not completely true! My bud modded mine for free, he also made it that i can’t get the RRoD… All you have to do is tighten/untighten a few bolts. ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:42, topic:282126”][quote author=sppt link=topic=372777.msg2819445#msg2819445 date=1244499062]

The Wii is the family wii im not allowed to fiddle with it so im sorta stuck in that respect

Though we’ve had our disagreements I can relate to you when it comes to this.

I would mod my console but chip is a waste of money and her in Australia we have limited download usage so if I download say 2 games a month that’s like 14GB of my 30GB downloads that are instantly gone.
They’re bringing out unlimited usage here soon can’t wait for it, it’ll be only a few more months
[/quote]You do not have to chip it!

yeah but flashing the family wii would only end badly

Not if you install bootmii first, so you can remove the shit that broke your wii.
I personally softmodded mine using the twilight princess hack, and it works fine. I believe that chance of your wii actually breaking by softmodding is really low.

not breaking it but the fact that my mum would probably rage at me fiddling with it and even more so if i start playing illegal games on it, if its on my computer she doesnt mind but the wii would be crossing a line[/quote]What a cunt. I’ve been playing burned xbox 360 games for 3+ months now. I haven’t gotten banned yet either, iXtreme is pretty safe firmware.

Read full topic

I personally softmodded mine using the twilight princess hack, and it works fine. I believe that chance of your wii actually breaking by softmodding is really low.[/quote]
not breaking it but the fact that my mum would probably rage at me fiddling with it and even more so if i start playing illegal games on it, if its on my computer she doesnt mind but the wii would be crossing a line

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:40, topic:282126”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=372777.msg2815524#msg2815524 date=1244259830]

I’m just going off of srt8’s brother who has had 7 or 8 Xbox 360s so far because they keep burning out

PEBTAS

(tv and sofa)
[/quote]

How? All he does is play it, it sits on top of his TV and not in a small enclosed space or anything. Decent hardware should be fine under those conditions.[/quote]

I don’t know how but my xbox’s harddrive got fucked up so bad it made 3 of my disks unplayable and scratched most of the rest to the point where they glitched terribly freezing randomly all the time. I had to return fable 2, 3 times before I got a copy that didn’t get scratched soon as it went in my xbox. I cleaned my xbox out, it’s in good condition out in the open and yer. I couldn’t get my xbox fixed for over half a year when I reluctantly got the RROD of which has 3 years warrently and normal xbox damage has 1 year which had already expired.

I’ve heard horror stories about xbox’s breaking and though I havn’t personally experienced it and my mates have only had similar, small problems like mine, if the average xbox breaks or has huge problems then it’s pretty likely at least half of those stories about xbox’s breaking over and over are true.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:34, topic:282126”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=372777.msg2817036#msg2817036 date=1244344780]

Though we’ve had our disagreements I can relate to you when it comes to this.

I would mod my console but chip is a waste of money and her in Australia we have limited download usage so if I download say 2 games a month that’s like 14GB of my 30GB downloads that are instantly gone.
They’re bringing out unlimited usage here soon can’t wait for it, it’ll be only a few more months
[/quote]You do not have to chip it!

yeah but flashing the family wii would only end badly[/quote]
Not if you install bootmii first, so you can remove the shit that broke your wii.
I personally softmodded mine using the twilight princess hack, and it works fine. I believe that chance of your wii actually breaking by softmodding is really low.

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Tico135:

After that depending on who you get your games from they’re about $10 each.

You figuring the cost of electricity used to run your comp while you download them?..blank dvds shouldn’t come out to 10$ a game…

sanga282:

but I probably won’t have XBL because of it’s large price tag

That and the fact that you will be banned for playing burnt games over XBL. Its just a matter of time before they catch you…

Also in order to have your comp burn 360 games you need a certain model of a drive flashed with a certain “kreon” firmware.

Edit:
the bank is talking about using the xbox’s own drive to burn games, apparently thats the method that results in the least amount of coasters.

Read full topic

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

@thebank, you can’t just burn 360 games to a DVD like Wii games?

i thought you could, if you cant this may not really be worth the trouble

[quote=“the bank, post:24, topic:282126”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=372777.msg2815321#msg2815321 date=1244247396]
@mitb, i have had my 360 for over a year and a half
[/quote]Had mine for 2, it just fuckign idiots who leave their 360’s on for days straight cus they’re too fucking lazy to turn em off.

Also, Microsoft released a new power supply which solves 90% of the RROD problems, rendering ti more reliable than the PS3.

Protip: modding an xbox is easy, burning games isnt. you have to open your xbox EVERY TIME you want to copy a game to connect the drive to your computer via SATA. Not worth it in my opinion. Stop being cheap.[/quote]
i’ve got a PS3, in what way do you think im cheap

Read full topic

item.title: Chipped xbox 360
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

@mitb, i have had my 360 for over a year and a half
[/quote]Had mine for 2, it just fuckign idiots who leave their 360’s on for days straight cus they’re too fucking lazy to turn em off.

Also, Microsoft released a new power supply which solves 90% of the RROD problems, rendering ti more reliable than the PS3.

Protip: modding an xbox is easy, burning games isnt. you have to open your xbox EVERY TIME you want to copy a game to connect the drive to your computer via SATA. Not worth it in my opinion. Stop being cheap.[/quote]

You could just drill a hole in the case and mod the cables to have two SATA outputs so you can just hook it straight into your pc.
